messages: a4b88438a9db86082488664c9bda1ae5 (23:52): assarix: does wtp-2 have some especially desireable feature?
2a78e4ddb897d821d45a3ba9ce2078d5 (00:00): .. it has the word "eclipse" in it.  :)
a4b88438a9db86082488664c9bda1ae5 (00:02): heh. it is a cool word.
2712dacb27c6ab4aa7f3461fb1c1514e (00:12): is there a command line for undeploying a webapp without stopping tomcat?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:12): if you have hot-deploy enabled, just copy in the .war file
2712dacb27c6ab4aa7f3461fb1c1514e (00:14): i just need it to reload an xml. i suppose i could rename web.xml and rename it back, b ut that's hardly elegant.
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:37): there is a newb velocity question headed your way
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:39): dvayanu well, I've fallen back to using Image.getScaledInstance(), it's far superior to JAI's scaling, and about on-par with ImageMagick
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:39): velocity doesnt like doing normal things you know like a form variable going to the next page is just uncalled for
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:39): oh, and it's faster, to boot
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (00:39): pfn: you dont need to save it?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:39): dvayanu of course I need to save it
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:41): it's faster than JAI if I don't have the JAI accelerators installed
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:41): a little slower if I do
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (00:41): how do you save the java.awt.Image object?
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:42): dvayanu convert it back to a bufferedimage
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:42): from there I can use the JPEGCodec to write it out, etc.
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:43): the results are far superior to JAI for scaling
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:43): I'd give you screenshots, but I'm too lazy to switch back and forth on the algos
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:45): but yeah, I'm happy with the quality of thumbnails generated by AWT
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:46): but still far too contrasty and aliased
31cf935e8fa5e0cbf72107ef6437bf94 (00:46): hmm...strange bicubic was far better for us
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:46): Image.getScaledInstance produces much nicer photographic images
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:46): I learned that after digging around online
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:47): anyway, try that scaling algo I have in my code
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:47): it's a night and day difference almost
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:47): I guess I can write a test case to demonstrate for you
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (00:48): I'm bored and don't feel like doing any real work
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:53): it is about to make me write more java code to do something silly
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:54): sorry had to vent a bit
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:57): you know i assumed i knew how to form submit
232512572096a4d8680305f759bef6c5 (00:57): but i guess i dont know how
042f3b97816f38fc28999a500a3fef78 (01:00): meh, I need to go pick up my wife, I'll finish writing the demo/testcase in a minute
